page.title: 19TRADE - HEDINGHAM
page.content: Shops in the area are mainly small family-run concerns, although there is a large supermarket in Sible Hedingham. These include grocers, greengrocers, newsagents, butchers, bakers, a chemist, antique dealers and electrical dealers. There are three small-holdings which sell plants and vegetables. A coalyard on the outskirts of the village deals with 164,000 tons of coal a year and supplies fuel to a large area. Daily milk deliveries are made to households by a number of roundsmen. A mobile wet-fish van visits the village each Wednesday and fish and chip vans also call regularly. There is a small hairdressing saloon in the centre of the village. Three garages in the area sell petrol and a variety of products for cars and motorbikes, as well as sevicing vehicles.
